Vector Triangle::PointInTriangle (    )  [inline]
 

Generate a random point in the triangle.

Point IN Triangle: barycentric parametrisation, u, v : barycentric coordinates barycentric coord: to define the barycentric coordinates in R^n ( n= 2 the triangle) one needs (n+1) points (3 points in 3D) that do not lie in a space of a lesser dimension. From that we can find out the u,v barycentric coords. here do the reverse: from u, v barycentric coords, calculate the point

Definition at line 138 of file World.hpp.

References RAND, Vector::x, Vector::y, and Vector::z.

Referenced by StIter::DoIteration(), and LightSourceSample::Init().

00143                         u = 1.0f - u; 
00144                         v = 1.0f - v;
00145                 }
00146 
00147                 return Vector(
00148                         a->x + u * (b->x - a->x) + v * (c->x - a->x),
00149                         a->y + u * (b->y - a->y) + v * (c->y - a->y),
00150                         a->z + u * (b->z - a->z) + v * (c->z - a->z));
00151         }
